title: Tex-Mex Turkey Burgers
directions: Preheat grill to 350° to 400° (medium-high) heat. Grate zest from lime to equal 1 tsp. Cut lime in half, and squeeze juice from lime to equal 1 Tbsp.

Sauté onion and garlic in hot oil in a medium skillet 1 minute. Add corn, and cook 2 to 3 minutes or just until corn begins to brown. Transfer mixture to a medium bowl. Stir in lime zest, lime juice, avocado, cilantro, and 1/2 tsp. salt.
Combine turkey, next 4 ingredients, and remaining 1 tsp. salt. Gently shape mixture into 6 (4-inch) patties.
Grill patties, covered with grill lid, 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until done. Serve on tostadas with corn mixture and desired toppings.
ingredients: 1/4 cup finely chopped red onion $Click to see savings
2 garlic cloves, minced $Click to see savings
1 tablespoon olive oil $Click to see savings
1 avocado, peeled and finely chopped $Click to see savings
1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro leaves
1 pound ground turkey $Click to see savings
1 large egg, lightly beaten $Click to see savings
6 tostada shells, warmed $Click to see savings
Toppings: salsa verde, crumbled queso fresco
